metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5838 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to bypass intendedpassword-change restrictions by leveraging knowledge of a cookie.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
